leadership.description: You attract followers to your cause and a companion to join you on your adventures.

lightning_reflexes.name: Lightning Reflexes

sections.body: You get a +2 bonus on all Reflex saving throws.
sections.name: Benefits

lightning_reflexes.description: You have faster reflexes than normal.

lightning_stance.name: Lightning Stance

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Dex 17, Dodge, Wind Stance, base attack bonus +11.

sections.body: If you take two actions to move or a withdraw action in a turn, you gain 50% concealment for 1 round.
sections.name: Benefits

lightning_stance.description: The speed at which you move makes it nearly impossible for opponents to strike you.

lunge.name: Lunge

sections.body: You can increase the reach of your melee attacks by 5 feet until the end of your turn by taking a –2 penalty to your AC until your next turn. You must decide to use this ability before any attacks are made.
sections.name: Benefits

lunge.description: You can strike foes that would normally be out of reach.

magical_aptitude.name: Magical Aptitude

sections.body: You get a +2 bonus on all Spellcraft checks and Use Magic Device checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.
sections.name: Benefits

magical_aptitude.description: You are skilled at spellcasting and using magic items.

manyshot.name: Manyshot

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Dex 17, Point-Blank Shot, Rapid Shot, base attack bonus +6.

sections.body: When making a full-attack action with a bow, your first attack fires two arrows. If the attack hits, both arrows hit. Apply precision-based damage (such as sneak attack) and critical hit damage only once for this attack. Damage bonuses from using a composite bow with a high Strength bonus apply to each arrow, as do other damage bonuses, such as a ranger's favored enemy bonus. Damage reduction and resistances apply separately to each arrow.
sections.name: Benefits

manyshot.description: You can fire multiple arrows at a single target.

martial_weapon_proficiency.name: Martial Weapon Proficiency

sections.body: You make attack rolls with the selected weapon normally (without the non-proficient penalty).
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: When using a weapon with which you are not proficient, you take a –4 penalty on attack rolls.
sections.name: Normal

sections.body: Barbarians, fighters, paladins, and rangers are proficient with all martial weapons. They need not select this feat. You can gain Martial Weapon Proficiency multiple times. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.
sections.name: Special

martial_weapon_proficiency.description: Choose a type of martial weapon. You understand how to use that type of martial weapon in combat.

master_craftsman.name: Master Craftsman

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: 5 ranks in any Craft or Profession skill.

sections.body: Choose one Craft or Profession skill in which you possess at least 5 ranks. You receive a +2 bonus on your chosen Craft or Profession skill. Ranks in your chosen skill count as your caster level for the purposes of qualifying for the Craft Magic Arms and Armor and Craft Wondrous Item feats. You can create magic items using these feats, substituting your ranks in the chosen skill for your total caster level. You must use the chosen skill for the check to create the item. The DC to create the item still increases for any necessary spell requirements (see the magic item creation rules in Magic Items). You cannot use this feat to create any spell-trigger or spell-activation item.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: Only spellcasters can qualify for the Craft Magic Arms and Armor and Craft Wondrous Item feats.
sections.name: Normal

master_craftsman.description: Your superior crafting skills allow you to create simple magic items.

maximize_spell.name: Maximize Spell

sections.body: All variable, numeric effects of a spell modified by this feat are maximized. Saving throws and opposed rolls are not affected, nor are spells without random variables. A maximized spell uses up a spell slot three levels higher than the spell's actual level. An empowered, maximized spell gains the separate benefits of each feat: the maximum result plus half the normally rolled result.
sections.name: Benefits

maximize_spell.description: Your spells have the maximum possible effect.

medusas_wrath.name: Medusa's Wrath

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Improved Unarmed Strike, Gorgon's Fist, Scorpion Style, base attack bonus +11.

sections.body: Whenever you use the full-attack action and make at least one unarmed strike, you can make two additional unarmed strikes at your highest base attack bonus. These bonus attacks must be made against a dazed, flat-footed, paralyzed, staggered, stunned, or unconscious foe.
sections.name: Benefits

medusas_wrath.description: You can take advantage of your opponent's confusion, delivering multiple blows.

mobility.name: Mobility

sections.body: You get a +4 dodge bonus to Armor Class against attacks of opportunity caused when you move out of or within a threatened area. A condition that makes you lose your Dexterity bonus to Armor Class (if any) also makes you lose dodge bonuses. Dodge bonuses stack with each other, unlike most types of bonuses.
sections.name: Benefits

mobility.description: You can easily move through a dangerous melee.

mounted_archery.name: Mounted Archery

sections.body: The penalty you take when using a ranged weapon while mounted is halved: –2 instead of –4 if your mount is taking a double move, and –4 instead of –8 if your mount is running.
sections.name: Benefits

mounted_archery.description: You are skilled at making ranged attacks while mounted.

mounted_combat.name: Mounted Combat

sections.body: Once per round when your mount is hit in combat, you may attempt a Ride check (as an immediate action) to negate the hit. The hit is negated if your Ride check result is greater than the opponent's attack roll.
sections.name: Benefits

mounted_combat.description: You are adept at guiding your mount through combat.

natural_spell.name: Natural Spell

sections.body: You can complete the verbal and somatic components of spells while using wild shape. You substitute various noises and gestures for the normal verbal and somatic components of a spell. You can also use any material components or focuses you possess, even if such items are melded within your current form. This feat does not permit the use of magic items while you are in a form that could not ordinarily use them, and you do not gain the ability to speak while using wild shape.
sections.name: Benefits

natural_spell.description: You can cast spells even while in a form that cannot normally cast spells.

nimble_moves.name: Nimble Moves

sections.body: Whenever you move, you may move through 5 feet of difficult terrain each round as if it were normal terrain. This feat allows you to take a 5-foot step into difficult terrain.
sections.name: Benefits

nimble_moves.description: You can move across a single obstacle with ease.

penetrating_strike.name: Penetrating Strike

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Weapon Focus, base attack bonus +1, 12th-level fighter, proficiency with weapon.

sections.body: Your attacks with weapons selected with Weapon Focus ignore up to 5 points of damage reduction. This feat does not apply to damage reduction without a type (such as DR 10/—).
sections.name: Benefits

penetrating_strike.description: Your attacks are capable of penetrating the defenses of some creatures.

persuasive.name: Persuasive

sections.body: You get a +2 bonus on Diplomacy and Intimidate skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.
sections.name: Benefits

persuasive.description: You are skilled at swaying attitudes and intimidating others into your way of thinking.

pinpoint_targeting.name: Pinpoint Targeting

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Dex 19, Improved Precise Shot, Point-Blank Shot, Precise Shot, base attack bonus +16.

sections.body: As a standard action, make a single ranged attack. The target does not gain any armor, natural armor, or shield bonuses to its Armor Class. You do not gain the benefit of this feat if you move this round.
sections.name: Benefits

pinpoint_targeting.description: You can target the weak points in your opponent's armor.

point-blank_shot.name: Point-Blank Shot

sections.body: You get a +1 bonus on attack and damage rolls with ranged weapons at ranges of up to 30 feet.
sections.name: Benefits

point-blank_shot.description: You are especially accurate when making ranged attacks against close targets.

power_attack.name: Power Attack

sections.body: You can choose to take a –1 penalty on all melee attack rolls and combat maneuver checks to gain a +2 bonus on all melee damage rolls. This bonus to damage is increased by half (+50%) if you are making an attack with a two-handed weapon, a one handed weapon using two hands, or a primary natural weapon that adds 1-1/2 times your Strength modifier on damage rolls. This bonus to damage is halved (–50%) if you are making an attack with an off-hand weapon or secondary natural weapon. When your base attack bonus reaches +4, and every 4 points thereafter, the penalty increases by –1 and the bonus to damage increases by +2. You must choose to use this feat before making an attack roll, and its effects last until your next turn. The bonus damage does not apply to touch attacks or effects that do not deal hit point damage.
sections.name: Benefits

power_attack.description: You can make exceptionally deadly melee attacks by sacrificing accuracy for strength.

precise_shot.name: Precise Shot

sections.body: You can shoot or throw ranged weapons at an opponent engaged in melee without taking the standard –4 penalty on your attack roll.
sections.name: Benefits

precise_shot.description: You are adept at firing ranged attacks into melee.

quick_draw.name: Quick Draw

sections.body: You can draw a weapon as a free action instead of as a move action. You can draw a hidden weapon (see the Sleight of Hand skill) as a move action. A character who has selected this feat may throw weapons at his full normal rate of attacks (much like a character with a bow). Alchemical items, potions, scrolls, and wands cannot be drawn quickly using this feat.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: Without this feat, you may draw a weapon as a move action, or (if your base attack bonus is +1 or higher) as a free action as part of movement. Without this feat, you can draw a hidden weapon as a standard action.
sections.name: Normal

quick_draw.description: You can draw weapons faster than most.

quicken_spell.name: Quicken Spell

sections.body: Casting a quickened spell is a swift action. You can perform another action, even casting another spell, in the same round as you cast a quickened spell. A spell whose casting time is more than 1 round or 1 full-round action cannot be quickened. A quickened spell uses up a spell slot four levels higher than the spell's actual level. Casting a quickened spell doesn't provoke an attack of opportunity.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: You can apply the effects of this feat to a spell cast spontaneously, so long as it has a casting time that is not more than 1 full-round action, without increasing the spell's casting time.
sections.name: Special

quicken_spell.description: You can cast spells in a fraction of the normal time.

rapid_shot.name: Rapid Shot

sections.body: When making a full-attack action with a ranged weapon, you can fire one additional time this round. All of your attack rolls take a –2 penalty when using Rapid Shot.
sections.name: Benefits

rapid_shot.description: You can make an additional ranged attack.

ride-by_attack.name: Ride-By Attack

sections.body: When you are mounted and use the charge action, you may move and attack as if with a standard charge and then move again (continuing the straight line of the charge). Your total movement for the round can't exceed double your mounted speed. You and your mount do not provoke an attack of opportunity from the opponent that you attack.
sections.name: Benefits

ride-by_attack.description: While mounted and charging, you can move, strike at a foe, and then continue moving.

sections.body: When running, you move five times your normal speed (if wearing medium, light, or no armor and carrying no more than a medium load) or four times your speed (if wearing heavy armor or carrying a heavy load). If you make a jump after a running start (see the Acrobatics skill description), you gain a +4 bonus on your Acrobatics check. While running, you retain your Dexterity bonus to your Armor Class.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: You move four times your speed while running (if wearing medium, light, or no armor and carrying no more than a medium load) or three times your speed (if wearing heavy armor or carrying a heavy load), and you lose your Dexterity bonus to AC.
sections.name: Normal

scorpion_style.name: Scorpion Style

sections.body: To use this feat, you must make a single unarmed attack as a standard action. If this unarmed attack hits, you deal damage normally, and the target's base land speed is reduced to 5 feet for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom modifier unless it makes a Fortitude saving throw (DC 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wis modifier).
sections.name: Benefits

scorpion_style.description: You can perform an unarmed strike that greatly hampers your target's movement.

sections.body: You can create a scroll of any spell that you know. Scribing a scroll takes 2 hours if its base price is 250 gp or less, otherwise scribing a scroll takes 1 day for each 1,000 gp in its base price. To scribe a scroll, you must use up raw materials costing half of this base price. See the magic item creation rules in Magic Items for more information.
sections.name: Benefits

selective_channeling.name: Selective Channeling

sections.body: When you channel energy, you can choose a number of targets in the area up to your Charisma modifier. These targets are not affected by your channeled energy.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: All targets in a 30-foot burst are affected when you channel energy. You can only choose whether or not you are affected.
sections.name: Normal

selective_channeling.description: You can choose whom to affect when you channel energy.

self-sufficient.name: Self-Sufficient

sections.body: You get a +2 bonus on all Heal checks and Survival checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.
sections.name: Benefits

self-sufficient.description: You know how to get along in the wild and how to effectively treat wounds.

shatter_defenses.name: Shatter Defenses

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Weapon Focus, Dazzling Display, base attack bonus +6, proficiency with weapon.

sections.body: Any shaken, frightened, or panicked opponent hit by you this round is flat-footed to your attacks until the end of your next turn. This includes any additional attacks you make this round.
sections.name: Benefits

shatter_defenses.description: Your skill with your chosen weapon leaves opponents unable to defend themselves if you strike them when their defenses are already compromised.

shield_focus.name: Shield Focus

sections.body: Increase the AC bonus granted by any shield you are using by 1.
sections.name: Benefits

shield_focus.description: You are skilled at deflecting blows with your shield.

shield_master.name: Shield Master

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Improved Shield Bash, Shield Proficiency, Shield Slam, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +11.

sections.body: You do not suffer any penalties on attack rolls made with a shield while you are wielding another weapon. Add your shield's enhancement bonus to attacks and damage rolls made with the shield as if it was a weapon enhancement bonus.
sections.name: Benefits

shield_master.description: Your mastery of the shield allows you to fight with it without hindrance.

shield_proficiency.name: Shield Proficiency

sections.body: When you use a shield (except a tower shield), the shield's armor check penalty only applies to Strength- and Dexterity-based skills.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: When you are using a shield with which you are not proficient, you take the shield's armor check penalty on attack rolls and on all skill checks that involve moving.
sections.name: Normal

sections.body: Barbarians, bards, clerics, druids, fighters, paladins, and rangers all automatically have Shield Proficiency as a bonus feat. They need not select it.
sections.name: Special

shield_proficiency.description: You are trained in how to properly use a shield.

shield_slam.name: Shield Slam

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Improved Shield Bash, Shield Proficiency, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +6.

sections.body: Any opponents hit by your shield bash are also hit with a free bull rush attack, substituting your attack roll for the combat maneuver check (see Combat). This bull rush does not provoke an attack of opportunity. Opponents who cannot move back due to a wall or other surface are knocked prone after moving the maximum possible distance. You may choose to move with your target if you are able to take a 5-foot step or to spend an action to move this turn.
sections.name: Benefits

shield_slam.description: In the right position, your shield can be used to send opponents flying.

shot_on_the_run.name: Shot on the Run

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Dex 13, Dodge, Mobility, Point-Blank Shot, base attack bonus +4.

sections.body: As a full-round action, you can move up to your speed and make a single ranged attack at any point during your movement.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: You cannot move before and after an attack with a ranged weapon.
sections.name: Normal

shot_on_the_run.description: You can move, fire a ranged weapon, and move again before your foes can react.

sickening_critical.name: Sickening Critical

sections.body: Whenever you score a critical hit, your opponent becomes sickened for 1 minute. The effects of this feat do not stack. Additional hits instead add to the effect's duration.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess Critical Mastery.
sections.name: Special

sickening_critical.description: Your critical hits cause opponents to become sickened.

silent_spell.name: Silent Spell

sections.body: A silent spell can be cast with no verbal components. Spells without verbal components are not affected. A silent spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: Bard spells cannot be enhanced by this feat.
sections.name: Special

silent_spell.description: You can cast your spells without making any sound.

simple_weapon_proficiency.name: Simple Weapon Proficiency

sections.body: You make attack rolls with simple weapons without penalty.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: When using a weapon with which you are not proficient, you take a –4 penalty on attack rolls.
sections.name: Normal

sections.body: All characters except for druids, monks, and wizards are automatically proficient with all simple weapons. They need not select this feat.
sections.name: Special

simple_weapon_proficiency.description: You are trained in the use of basic weapons.

skill_focus.name: Skill Focus

sections.body: You get a +3 bonus on all checks involving the chosen skill. If you have 10 or more ranks in that skill, this bonus increases to +6.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new skill.
sections.name: Special

skill_focus.description: Choose a skill. You are particularly adept at that skill.

snatch_arrows.name: Snatch Arrows

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Dex 15, Deflect Arrows, Improved Unarmed Strike.

sections.body: When using the Deflect Arrows feat you may choose to catch the weapon instead of just deflecting it. Thrown weapons can immediately be thrown back as an attack against the original attacker (even though it isn't your turn) or kept for later use. You must have at least one hand free (holding nothing) to use this feat.
sections.name: Benefits

snatch_arrows.description: Instead of knocking an arrow or ranged attack aside, you can catch it in mid-flight.

spellbreaker.name: Spellbreaker

sections.body: Enemies in your threatened area that fail their checks to cast spells defensively provoke attacks of opportunity from you.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: Enemies that fail to cast spells defensively do not provoke attacks of opportunity.
sections.name: Normal

spellbreaker.description: You can strike at enemy spellcasters who fail to cast defensively when you threaten them.

spell_focus.name: Spell Focus

sections.body: Add +1 to the Difficulty Class for all saving throws against spells from the school of magic you select.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new school of magic.
sections.name: Special

spell_focus.description: Choose a school of magic. Any spells you cast of that school are more difficult to resist.

spell_mastery.name: Spell Mastery

sections.body: Each time you take this feat, choose a number of spells that you already know equal to your Intelligence modifier. From that point on, you can prepare these spells without referring to a spellbook.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: Without this feat, you must use a spellbook to prepare all your spells, except read magic.
sections.name: Normal

spell_mastery.description: You have mastered a small handful of spells, and can prepare these spells without referencing your spellbooks at all.

spell_penetration.name: Spell Penetration

sections.body: You get a +2 bonus on caster level checks (1d20 + caster level) made to overcome a creature's spell resistance.
sections.name: Benefits

spell_penetration.description: Your spells break through spell resistance more easily than most.

spirited_charge.name: Spirited Charge

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Ride 1 rank, Mounted Combat, Ride-By Attack.

sections.body: When mounted and using the charge action, you deal double damage with a melee weapon (or triple damage with a lance).
sections.name: Benefits

spirited_charge.description: Your mounted charge attacks deal a tremendous amount of damage.

spring_attack.name: Spring Attack

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Dex 13, Dodge, Mobility, base attack bonus +4.

sections.body: As a full-round action, you can move up to your speed and make a single melee attack without provoking any attacks of opportunity from the target of your attack. You can move both before and after the attack, but you must move at least 10 feet before the attack and the total distance that you move cannot be greater than your speed. You cannot use this ability to attack a foe that is adjacent to you at the start of your turn.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: You cannot move before and after an attack.
sections.name: Normal

spring_attack.description: You can deftly move up to a foe, strike, and withdraw before he can react.

staggering_critical.name: Staggering Critical

sections.body: Whenever you score a critical hit, your opponent becomes staggered for 1d4+1 rounds. A successful Fortitude save reduces the duration to 1 round. The DC of this Fortitude save is equal to 10 + your base attack bonus. The effects of this feat do not stack. Additional hits instead add to the duration.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess Critical Mastery.
sections.name: Special

staggering_critical.description: Your critical hits cause opponents to slow down.

stand_still.name: Stand Still

sections.body: When a foe provokes an attack of opportunity due to moving through your adjacent squares, you can make a combat maneuver check as your attack of opportunity. If successful, the enemy cannot move for the rest of his turn. An enemy can still take the rest of his action, but cannot move. This feat also applies to any creature that attempts to move from a square that is adjacent to you if such movement provokes an attack of opportunity.
sections.name: Benefits

stand_still.description: You can stop foes that try to move past you.

stealthy.name: Stealthy

sections.body: You get a +2 bonus on all Escape Artist and Stealth skill checks. If you have 10 or more ranks in one of these skills, the bonus increases to +4 for that skill.
sections.name: Benefits

stealthy.description: You are good at avoiding unwanted attention and slipping out of bonds.

step_up.name: Step Up

sections.body: Whenever an adjacent foe attempts to take a 5-foot step away from you, you may also make a 5-foot step as an immediate action so long as you end up adjacent to the foe that triggered this ability. If you take this step, you cannot take a 5-foot step during your next turn. If you take an action to move during your next turn, subtract 5 feet from your total movement.
sections.name: Benefits

step_up.description: You can close the distance when a foe tries to move away.

still_spell.name: Still Spell

sections.body: A stilled spell can be cast with no somatic components. Spells without somatic components are not affected. A stilled spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.
sections.name: Benefits

still_spell.description: You can cast spells without moving.

strike_back.name: Strike Back

sections.body: You can ready an action to make a melee attack against any foe that attacks you in melee, even if the foe is outside of your reach.
sections.name: Benefits

strike_back.description: You can strike at foes that attack you using their superior reach, by targeting their limbs or weapons as they come at you.

stunning_critical.name: Stunning Critical

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Critical Focus, Staggering Critical, base attack bonus +17.

sections.body: Whenever you score a critical hit, your opponent becomes stunned for 1d4 rounds. A successful Fortitude save reduces this to staggered for 1d4 rounds. The DC of this Fortitude save is equal to 10 + your base attack bonus. The effects of this feat do not stack. Additional hits instead add to the duration.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess Critical Mastery.
sections.name: Special

stunning_critical.description: Your critical hits cause opponents to become stunned.

stunning_fist.name: Stunning Fist

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Dex 13, Wis 13, Improved Unarmed Strike, base attack bonus +8.

sections.body: You must declare that you are using this feat before you make your attack roll (thus, a failed attack roll ruins the attempt). Stunning Fist forces a foe damaged by your unarmed attack to make a Fortitude saving throw (DC 10 + 1/2 your character level + your Wis modifier), in addition to dealing damage normally. A defender who fails this saving throw is stunned for 1 round (until just before your next turn). A stunned character drops everything held, can't take actions, loses any Dexterity bonus to AC, and takes a –2 penalty to AC. You may attempt a stunning attack once per day for every four levels you have attained (but see Special), and no more than once per round. Constructs, oozes, plants, undead, incorporeal creatures, and creatures immune to critical hits cannot be stunned.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: A monk receives Stunning Fist as a bonus feat at 1st level, even if he does not meet the prerequisites. A monk may attempt a stunning attack a number of times per day equal to his monk level, plus one more time per day for every four levels he has in classes other than monk.
sections.name: Special

stunning_fist.description: You know just where to strike to temporarily stun a foe.

throw_anything.name: Throw Anything

sections.body: You do not suffer any penalties for using an improvised ranged weapon. You receive a +1 circumstance bonus on attack rolls made with thrown splash weapons.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: You take a –4 penalty on attack rolls made with an improvised weapon.
sections.name: Normal

throw_anything.description: You are used to throwing things you have on hand.

tiring_critical.name: Tiring Critical

sections.body: Whenever you score a critical hit, your opponent becomes fatigued. This feat has no additional effect on a fatigued or exhausted creature.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: You can only apply the effects of one critical feat to a given critical hit unless you possess Critical Mastery.
sections.name: Special

tiring_critical.description: Your critical hits cause opponents to become fatigued.

sections.body: You gain +3 hit points. For every Hit Die you possess beyond 3, you gain an additional +1 hit point. If you have more than 3 Hit Dice, you gain +1 hit points whenever you gain a Hit Die (such as when you gain a level).
sections.name: Benefits

tower_shield_proficiency.name: Tower Shield Proficiency

sections.body: When you use a tower shield, the shield's armor check penalty only applies to Strength and Dexterity-based skills.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: A character using a shield with which he is not proficient takes the shield's armor check penalty on attack rolls and on all skill checks that involve moving, including Ride.
sections.name: Normal

sections.body: Fighters automatically have Tower Shield Proficiency as a bonus feat. They need not select it.
sections.name: Special

tower_shield_proficiency.description: You are trained in how to properly use a tower shield.

trample.name: Trample

sections.body: When you attempt to overrun an opponent while mounted, your target may not choose to avoid you. Your mount may make one hoof attack against any target you knock down, gaining the standard +4 bonus on attack rolls against prone targets.
sections.name: Benefits

trample.description: While mounted, you can ride down opponents and trample them under your mount.

turn_undead.name: Turn Undead

sections.body: You can, as a standard action, use one of your uses of channel positive energy to cause all undead within 30 feet of you to flee, as if panicked. Undead receive a Will save to negate the effect. The DC for this Will save is equal to 10 + 1/2 your cleric level + your Charisma modifier. Undead that fail their save flee for 1 minute. Intelligent undead receive a new saving throw each round to end the effect. If you use channel energy in this way, it has no other effect (it does not heal or harm nearby creatures).
sections.name: Benefits

turn_undead.description: Calling upon higher powers, you cause undead to flee from the might of your unleashed divine energy.

two-weapon_defense.name: Two-Weapon Defense

sections.body: When wielding a double weapon or two weapons (not including natural weapons or unarmed strikes), you gain a +1 shield bonus to your AC. When you are fighting defensively or using the total defense action, this shield bonus increases to +2.
sections.name: Benefits

two-weapon_defense.description: You are skilled at defending yourself while dual-wielding.

two-weapon_fighting.name: Two-Weapon Fighting

sections.body: Your penalties on attack rolls for fighting with two weapons are reduced. The penalty for your primary hand lessens by 2 and the one for your off hand lessens by 6. See Two-Weapon Fighting in Combat.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: If you wield a second weapon in your off hand, you can get one extra attack per round with that weapon. When fighting in this way you suffer a –6 penalty with your regular attack or attacks with your primary hand and a –10 penalty to the attack with your off hand. If your off-hand weapon is light, the penalties are reduced by 2 each. An unarmed strike is always considered light.
sections.name: Normal

two-weapon_fighting.description: You can fight with a weapon wielded in each of your hands. You can make one extra attack each round with the secondary weapon.

two-weapon_rend.name: Two-Weapon Rend

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Dex 17, Double Slice, Improved Two-Weapon Fighting, Two-Weapon Fighting, base attack bonus +11.

sections.body: If you hit an opponent with both your primary hand and your off-hand weapon, you deal an additional 1d10 points of damage plus 1-1/2 times your Strength modifier. You can only deal this additional damage once each round.
sections.name: Benefits

two-weapon_rend.description: Striking with both of your weapons simultaneously, you can use them to deliver devastating wounds.

unseat.name: Unseat

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Str 13, Ride 1 rank, Mounted Combat, Power Attack, Improved Bull Rush, base attack bonus +1.

sections.body: When charging an opponent while mounted and wielding a lance, resolve the attack as normal. If it hits, you may immediately make a free bull rush attempt in addition to the normal damage. If successful, the target is knocked off his horse and lands prone in a space adjacent to his mount that is directly away from you.
sections.name: Benefits

unseat.description: You are skilled at unseating your mounted opponents.

vital_strike.name: Vital Strike

sections.body: When you use the attack action, you can make one attack at your highest base attack bonus that deals additional damage. Roll the weapon's damage dice for the attack twice and add the results together before adding bonuses from Strength, weapon abilities (such as flaming), precision based damage, and other damage bonuses. These extra weapon damage dice are not multiplied on a critical hit, but are added to the total.
sections.name: Benefits

vital_strike.description: You make a single attack that deals significantly more damage than normal.

weapon_finesse.name: Weapon Finesse

sections.body: With a light weapon, rapier, whip, or spiked chain made for a creature of your size category, you may use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls. If you carry a shield, its armor check penalty applies to your attack rolls.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: Natural weapons are considered light weapons.
sections.name: Special

weapon_finesse.description: You are trained in using your agility in melee combat, as opposed to brute strength.

weapon_focus.name: Weapon Focus

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Proficiency with selected weapon, base attack bonus +1.

sections.body: You gain a +1 bonus on all attack rolls you make using the selected weapon.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.
sections.name: Special

weapon_focus.description: Choose one type of weapon. You can also choose unarmed strike or grapple (or ray, if you are a spellcaster) as your weapon for the purposes of this feat.

weapon_specialization.name: Weapon Specialization

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Proficiency with selected weapon, Weapon Focus with selected weapon, fighter level 4th.

sections.body: You gain a +2 bonus on all damage rolls you make using the selected weapon.
sections.name: Benefits

sections.body: You can gain this feat multiple times. Its effects do not stack. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of weapon.
sections.name: Special

weapon_specialization.description: You are skilled at dealing damage with one weapon. Choose one type of weapon (including unarmed strike or grapple) for which you have already selected the Weapon Focus feat. You deal extra damage when using this weapon.

whirlwind_attack.name: Whirlwind Attack

sections.name: Prerequisites
sections.description: Dex 13, Int 13, Combat Expertise, Dodge, Mobility, Spring Attack, base attack bonus +4.

sections.body: When you use the full-attack action, you can give up your regular attacks and instead make one melee attack at your highest base attack bonus against each opponent within reach. You must make a separate attack roll against each opponent. When you use the Whirlwind Attack feat, you also forfeit any bonus or extra attacks granted by other feats, spells, or abilities.
sections.name: Benefits

whirlwind_attack.description: You can strike out at every foe within reach.

widen_spell.name: Widen Spell

sections.body: You can alter a burst, emanation, or spread-shaped spell to increase its area. Any numeric measurements of the spell's area increase by 100%. A widened spell uses up a spell slot three levels higher than the spell's actual level. Spells that do not have an area of one of these four sorts are not affected by this feat.
sections.name: Benefits

widen_spell.description: You can cast your spells so that they occupy a larger space.

wind_stance.name: Wind Stance

sections.body: If you move more than 5 feet this turn, you gain 20% concealment for 1 round against ranged attacks.
sections.name: Benefits

wind_stance.description: Your erratic movements make it difficult for enemies to pinpoint your location.
